modName: Windows to The Soul Eyes LE - DELETED
summary: Default eye texture replacer WITH BENEFITS!
descriptionHtml:
[size=6][b][center]Now you too can have eyes like the Shmoo![/center][/b][/size]
[size=3]A special thank you to [b]RXKX22 [/b]for giving me permission to use screenshots of the Bijin ladies to showcase some of these eyes!

Windows to The Soul is an eye texture replacer that I have been using for many years in LE and now SE. I basically collected all my favorite eyes from all my favorite eye mods. Since I never thought I could get all the permissions, I never tried. Still missing permission from a fourth eye mod author. Replaced with substitute eyes from the three I currently have permission from...for now. So hopefully I will be able to get closer to my original setup soon.
[/size]

[b][size=4]For the most part, in a nutshell...
[/size]
[/b][size=3]Human and elf eyes are from The Eyes of Beauty - Player[/size]
[size=3]Argonians, Khajiit, and Orcs are from Improved Eyes Skyrim[/size]
[size=3]Some important eyes and miscellaneous files are from Natural Eyes[/size]


[b][size=5]You WANT to read this!
[/size][/b]
[size=4]This is NOT your average eye mod!

This mod includes eye tweaks which will improve many and in some cases all of the eyes from your other eye, NPC, or follower mods that you have installed!

Assuming you do not overwrite any important files from this mod and your NPC or follower mods are set to use default.

This is how I make my Bijin eyes so beautiful.

Now that I have exposed my secret, what will you do now? :P[/size]


[b][size=4]Instructions[/size]
[/b]
[size=3]You should also get these eyes in the character creation menu...assuming you do not overwrite them with some other eye mod.[/size]

[size=3]For best results, use an ENB that is updated and includes reflections.[/size]

[size=3]Results will vary according to your hardware, settings, ENB, weather, and lighting choices.[/size]

[size=3]Unfortunately, the only way to get rid of the glowing vampire eyes is to use a vampire head mesh replacer. The glow is not located in the eye mesh, but is in the eyelid part of every vampire head mesh. So every vampire head mesh in the game would need to be edited. Even with the glow the eyes do not look bad though![/size]

[size=3]Install after any other eye mods and before any NPC or follower mods.Â [/size]

[size=3]Your NPC and follower mods will still benefit from the eye normals, eye environment masks, and eye skin maps as long as their meshes are set to use default. Which...most usually are. So I install this mod archive after hair and any other eye mods, but before my NPC or follower mods.[/size]

[size=3]This mod does not include an eye cubemap, so if you do plan to replace the eye cubemap then the eyes may look different. I just use the default Bethesda eye cubemap, as do most NPC and follower mods.[/size]


[b][size=4]Credits (so far):

[size=3]Improved Eyes Syrim by MissJennaBee and Nazenn = IES[/size]
